bibl.title: General Orders, Watson B. Smith in Marysville, Tenn. 1863 Nov. 6
bibl.note: By command of Brig. Gen. Sanders, Watson B. Smith wrote to Lt. Col. Adams and his regiment (1st Ky Cav.) extending the thanks of Maj. General Burnside for the daring attack they made against the enemy at Motley Island Ford, Little Tennessee River in which they captured thirty-five prisoners and killed many more without loss to themselves. Smith asked that Adams make out a statement and send to the Tribune and to forward the inclosure to Harper.

div.p: With pleasure the General Commanding the 1st Div hereby extends the thanks of Maj Genl Burnside, comdg Army of the Ohio, by his direction, to Lt Col Adams and his Regiment (1st Ky Cav.) for the daring attack of the enemy, in far superior numbers, at Motley Island Ford, Little Tenn River, in which they captured thirty five (35) prisoners and killed and drowned large numbers without loss to themselves.
By Command of Brig Genl Sauders
If you please you might make out a little statement of the above mention affair &give it to the A & Tribune
